Notes.Text:
This update for djvulibre fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2025-53367: Fixed a bug where a crafted document may lead to an out of bound write. (bsc#1245773)
Notes.Title: Details

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server LTSS Extended Security 12 SP5
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server LTSS Extended Security 12 SP5

Vulnerabilities.Description: DjVuLibre is a GPL implementation of DjVu, a web-centric format for distributing documents and images. Prior to version 3.5.29, the MMRDecoder::scanruns method is affected by an OOB-write vulnerability, because it does not check that the xr pointer stays within the bounds of the allocated buffer. This can lead to writes beyond the allocated memory, resulting in a heap corruption condition. An out-of-bounds read with pr is also possible for the same reason. This issue has been patched in version 3.5.29.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server LTSS Extended Security 12 SP5:libdjvulibre-devel-3.5.25.3-5.25.1
